Label: Thessaly
Description: northern region of Greece (also called Aeolia)

Label: Lesbos
Description: island of the coast of modern Turkey

Label: Chryse
Description: town from which Agamemnon took Chryseis

Label: Hellespont
Description: the narrow crossing between Turkey and the rest of Europe

Label: Rhodes
Description: island off the SW coast of Turkey

Label: Lacedaemonia
Description: region around Sparta in the Peloponnese

Label: Mt. Parnassus
Description: mountain in central Greece near Delphi

Label: Pylos
Description: island off the southwest corner of the Peloponnese

Label: Phlius
Description: city in the northwestern Argolid in the Peloponnese

Label: Cilicia
Description: region in or near the Troad

Label: Sinope
Description: a town of Paphlagonia on the Black Sea

Label: Thrace
Description: region NE of Greece near Turkey

Label: Caucasus
Description: mountains separating Turkey from central Europe

Label: Ashkelon
Description: also spelled Ascalon, coastal city in modern Israel

Label: Doric/Dorian
Description: dialect encompassing a large part of Greece including the Peloponeese

Label: Nablus
Description: city in the Western Bank of modern day Israel (Neapolis)

Label: Zeleia
Description: town allied to Troy, at the foot of Mt. Ida

Label: Hyde
Description: a town on Mt. Tmolus in Lydia (possibly the later Sardis)

Label: Achaea
Description: region of Greece in the NW part of the Peloponese

Label: Euboea
Description: the island separated from Boeotia by the Eur?pus, named by Homer as the home of the Abantes

Label: Aegina
Description: Island off the western coast of Attica

Label: Aegean Sea
Description: part of the Mediterranean Sea, near Greece

Label: Myrtoan Sea
Description: part of the Aegean, between the Cyclades and the Peloponnese

Label: Istros
Description: Greek city in modern day Romania on Black Sea

Label: Aegospotami
Description: Small river issuing from the Hellespont

Label: Cnidos
Description: Greek settlement in modern day Turkey

Label: Cayster River
Description: Kaustros, small river in Turkey near Ephesus

Label: Mycale
Description: a promontory in lydia Minor, opposite Samos

Label: Miletus
Description: city in the Anatolia province of modern-day Turkey

Label: Sestus
Description: Sestos, Thracian city on the Hellespont, opposite Ab?dus

Label: Euripus
Description: Euripos, straight between Euboea and the mainland

Label: Cithaeron
Description: Kithairon, mountain; in a scene in battle of Plataea

Label: Nisa
Description: village on Mt. Helicon in Boeotia

Label: Anthedon
Description: town in Boeotia on the Euripus

Label: Orchomenus
Description: ancient city on Lake Copais in Boeotia

Label: Hyampolis
Description: town in Phocis, on the Cephissus

Label: Locris Ozolia
Description: home of the Ozolae, tribe of Locrians

Label: Abantes
Description: Abantians; ancient Ionian tribe that lived on Euboea, according to Aristotle of Chalcis, they may have originated from Abae near Phocis

Label: Eretria
Description: city on western coast of Euboea

Label: Curetes
Description: oldest inhabitants of Pleuron in Aetolia

Label: Troezen
Description: a town in Argolis, near the shore of the Saronic gulf

Label: Calauria
Description: Kalaureia, an island close to the coast of Troezen in the Peloponnesus

Label: Epidarus
Description: sanctuary to Ascleipius in the Peloponnese

Label: Mases
Description: a town in Argolis, near Hermione

Label: Amyclae
Description: a city in Laconia, near the Eurotas, 20 stadia S.E. of Sparta, and the residence of Tyndareus

Label: Triphylia
Description: area in the Peloponnese, "country of three tribes"

Label: Messene
Description: or Messe, city in the Peloponnese

Label: Echinades
Description: group of islands in the Ionian Sea

Label: Dulichium
Description: or Dolicha, or Doliche, island in the Echinades

Label: Crisa
Description: aka Krisa, near the Delphic oracle

Label: Imbros
Description: island off the coast of Thrace

Label: Batieia
Description: height on the plain of Troy before the city

Label: Veneto
Description: region in Northern Italy inhabited by the Veneti (Latin Heneti, Greek Enetoi)

Label: Sangarius
Description: a river flowing through Bithynia and Phrygia, and emptying into the Euxine

Label: Phthiron
Description: A mountain in Asia Minor in Karia near the city of Miletos
